NOTE: Workouts will be saved non-normalized as one single large workout object.

Although it is recommended to split IndexedDB objects into chunks as small as possible for performance reasons
(synchronous structuredClone() on main thread), I think these workout objects will never get so large that they
will have a significant performance impact.

I did a quick benchmark: A small Object can be cloned ~450k/109k times/s, while a huge object (huge in the subject
of this workout data structure) could still be serialized about ~45k/16k times/s

Thats more than enough and does not weigh enough against the simpler data-handling in development for now.

(If at some point in time it is really necessary, Dexie allows restructuring data in database-version-upgrades)

https://jsbench.me/

https://perf.link/#%3D%3D
